bibl.title: Thomas S. Brown and et al v. Thomas Jefferson Hamilton. Petition for Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Third Judicial District of Washington Territory

body.p: IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE THIRD JUDICAL DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON TERRITORY, HOLDING TERMS AT SEATTLE.

In the matter of the application of Thomas S. Brown, G. Geods, George No. 5267 Downing, Chas. Schubard, Carl Jong PETITION Matson named in the process as C.J. Young and Peter J. Wegner for a Writ of Habeas Corpus and discharge.
TO THE HON. RICHARD A. JONES, JUDGE OF THE ABOVE STYLED COURT:

Your petitioner Junius Rochester petitions the Court and says - That in this petition he appears in behalf of and as the agent of Thomas S. Brown, G. Geods, George Downing, Chas. Schubard, Carl Jong Matson named in the processes as C.J. Young and Peter J. Wegner.

II That the said persons above named were defendants in cases of the United States against them before Hon. C.D. Emery, United States Commissioner at Seattle in King County, with jurisdiction to hear and try certain causes at law

III That the above named persons are and each of them is illegaly, wrongfully and without any authority of law restrained of his liberty by Thomas Jefferson Hamilton United States Marshal for Washington Territory, at McNeils Island at the United States Penitentiary in the County of Washington Territory

IV That the cause and pretense of the restraint of the liberty of said persons and each of them is the alleged commission of acts which are in no wise a violation of any law of the United States or of the Territory of Washington, and which constitutes no crime, misdemeanor or offense whatever.

V That the illegality of the restraint herein complained of consists in the wrongful, unlawful and unwarranted detention of each of said persons named herein as detained by the said Hamilton upon an alleged commitment issued by C.D. Emery as aforesaid, which charges no offense against the laws of the United States or Territory of Washington, and

your petitioner further says, that the recitals in said commitments and in each of them, upon which the said Hamilton holds the said persons shows that there has been no crime or offense committed by said persons or either of them, and that the acts with which they and each of them is charged do no constitute any offense against the laws of the United States or Washington Territory, or any crime, misdemeanor or offese whatever: that the several commitments in the case of each of said persons are identical except the names of several defedants are different in each: a true and exact copy of one of said commitments, to wit: commitment in the case of Thomas S. Brown upon which said Thomas S. Brown is held as aforesaid, and which is the sole and only authority of the said Hamilton for detaining the siad persons or any of them, is hereto annexed as part hereof and made a part of this petition [marked exhibit A] and petitioner further says that the only offense charged against the said Thomas S. Brown or against any of said persons herein named is unlawfully restrained of their liberty, is that each "of said persons" on or about the 10th day of October 1887, in the Territory aforesaid, disobeyed the orders of the Master of the American ship Ivanhoe".
Petitioner says that there is no other or further cause for such detention save as above stated:

Wherefore your petitioner prays your Honor to grant unto the said Thomas S. Brown, G. Geods, Gerorge Downing, Chas. Schubarb, Carl Jong Matson named in the processes as C.J. Young and Peter J. Wegner a Writ of Habeas Corpus commanding and ordering the said Thomas Jefferson Hamilton to produce before your Honor at such time and place as your Honor deems wise and meet the bodies of the said Thomas S. Brown, G. Geods, George Downing, Chas. Schubarb, Carl Jong Matson named in the processes as C.J Young and Peter J. Wegner, and that your Honor will hear and determine whether they are or either of them is illegally detained or restrained of his liberty and that they and each of them be discharged and permitted to go their way without further delay detention,
Metcalfe + Rochester Junius Rochester Lewis + Gilman Petitioner and attys for plff + petitoner on behalf of plaintiffs
TERRITORY OF WASHINGTON COUNTY OF KING ------------------ - S. S.

PERSONALLY APPEARED BEFORE ME JUNIUS ROCHESTER WHO UPON OATH DEPOSES AND SAYS THAT HE APPEARS HEREIN UPON THE HALF AND AS THE AGENT OF THOMAS S. BROW., G. GEODS GEORGE DOWNING, CHARLES SCHUBARD, CARL JOHN MATSON KNOWS AS C.J. YOUNG AND PETER J. WEGENER, THAT HE IS THE PETITION ON THEIR BEHALF NAMED HEREIN AND IN THE AFORESAID AND HEREIN PETITOIN, THAT HE HAS READ THE SAID PETITION AND KNOWS THE CONETENTS THEREOF AND BELEIVES THE SAME TO BE TRUE.

Junius Rochester
SWORN TO AND SUVSCRIBED BEFORE ME THIS 15TH. DAY OF OCTOBER 1887.
Jacob Mctrafe Notary Public in and for Washington Territory
